title: Pandas: Basic GroupBy
story: GroupBy is fundamental for data aggregation. Split data into groups, apply functions, and combine results.
instructions: Group by 'department' and calculate the mean salary for each department. Print the result.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'department': ['HR', 'IT', 'HR', 'IT'],
    'salary': [50000, 60000, 55000, 65000]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# GroupBy department and get mean salary
result = df.groupby('department')['salary'].mean()
print(result)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'department': ['HR', 'IT', 'HR', 'IT'],
    'salary': [50000, 60000, 55000, 65000]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
result = df.groupby('department')['salary'].mean()
print(result)
